Docs.summary: Specifies the direction in which to sort a list of items.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SortDirection> enumeration is used to represent the direction in which items are sorted. It is commonly used by properties (such as the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.SortDirection%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> class) to indicate the order in which items are displayed in a control.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SortDirection> enumeration to determine the direction in which the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control is displaying its items. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView.SortDirection%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView> control is tested for its value to determine the sort direction.
